Make sure or set ETH1 as static IP
And DHCP Server should be started

Steps for sample Device A (Prepare one or more UC-8100-LX called device X (X could be A, B, ...)) 1. Navigate to Settings . Ethernet . eth1 2. Click Edit and select DHCP Server 3. Set values by DHCP server configuration 4. Direct connect LAN1 of device A with LAN2 of testing device, set LAN1 of device A as DHCP client
Then Device A should has following settings with LAN1
Make sure or set ETH2 as static IP
And DHCP Server should be started

Steps for sample Device A (Prepare one or more UC-8100-LX called device X (X could be A, B, ...)) 1. Navigate to Settings . Ethernet . eth1 2. Click Edit and select DHCP Server 3. Set values by DHCP server configuration 4. Direct connect LAN1 of device A with LAN3 of testing device, set LAN1 of device A as DHCP client
Then Device A should has following settings with LAN1
Make sure or set ETH3 as static IP
And DHCP Server should be started

To install the ThingsPro Device Enablement utility
In the Manage tab of the ThingsPro Device Enablement utility, click Auto Scan.
Select a network adapter from the drop-down list and click OK to continue.
Enter the Email and Password and click OK to continue. The default values are: Email: admin@moxa.com Password: admin1234
select the device from the device list.
Select Moxa CS (Moxa Cloud Server) in the Server Type field, enter the cloud server details, and click Apply.
Open the ThingsPro Gateway web user interface (web UI) for the device
check the parameters at System > CS Remote Control to confirm that the device is registered with the server.
And open CS web UI to check CG status
Calls : enable Connect to ThingsPro Server
And disable Connect to ThingsPro Server <http://squash.moxa.com:8006/squash/test-cases/159/info>
And open CS web UI to check CG status
